Package nzilbb.elpis

Class Elpis

  • Object
    • Elpis
  • public class Elpis
extends Object
    Client for accessing Elpis server functions programmatically.

    Functions are divided into five types, reflecting the four general steps for transcription:

    1. dataset… — upload existing transcripts with their recording, to provide training data;
    2. pronDict… — specify a pronunciation dictionary;
    3. model… — train language and acoustic models for automatic speech recognition;
    4. transcription… — automatic transcription of new recordings
    5. config… — clean up
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

      • pronDictL2S

        public void pronDictL2S​(File file)
                 throws IOException,
                        ElpisException
        Specify the letter-to-sound mapping for creating a pronunciation dictionary.

        The letter to sound file is used to build a pronunciation dictionary for the corpus. Make one by listing one column of all the characters in your corpus. Make a second column (separated by a space) of a symbol representing how that character is pronounced. You can use IPA, or SAMPA for the pronunciation symbols. You can include comments in this file by beginning the comment line with #. For example: 

        # This is a comment 
 n n
 ng Å‹
 r r
 y j
        Parameters:
        file - The plain-text file to upload.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs.
        ElpisException - if the server returns an error.

      • pronDictGenerateLexicon

        public Map<String,​String> pronDictGenerateLexicon()
                                                 throws IOException,
                                                        ElpisException
        Generate the pronunciation dictionary.

        This is a list of all words in the uploaded transcripts, followed by their pronunciations as generated by combining the word spelling with the letter-to-sound mapping uploaded with pronDictL2S(File).

        Returns:
        A map of word types to pronunciations.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs.
        ElpisException - if the server returns an error.

      • pronDictSaveLexicon

        public void pronDictSaveLexicon​(Map<String,​String> lexicon)
                         throws IOException,
                                ElpisException
        Update the pronunciation dictionary.

        This is a list of all words in the uploaded transcripts, mapped to their pronunciations; i.e. an edited version of the pronunciation dictionary generated by pronDictGenerateLexicon().

        Parameters:
        lexicon - A map of word types to pronunciations.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs.
        ElpisException - if the server returns an error.

      • transcriptionTranscribe

        public String transcriptionTranscribe()
                               throws IOException,
                                      ElpisException

        Returns:
        The status of the transcription.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs.
        ElpisException - if the server returns an error.

      • transcriptionText

        public String transcriptionText()
                         throws IOException,
                                ElpisException

        Returns:
        The transcript of the recording.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs.
        ElpisException - if the server returns an error.

      • transcriptionElan

        public File transcriptionElan()
                       throws IOException,
                              ElpisException
        Get the ELAN (.eaf) version of the last transcript created by transcriptionTranscribe(), which has a tier that includes an aligned annotation for each word token.
        Returns:
        A file containing the ELAN (.eaf) transcription of the recording, which should be deleted by the caller when no longer needed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs.
        ElpisException - if the server returns an error.

      • configReset

        public void configReset()
                 throws IOException,
                        ElpisException
        Reset the server - delete all uploads, datasets, pronunciation maps, etc.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication error occurs.
        ElpisException - if the server returns an error.
